intro: Psilochenia occidentalis subsp. costata, commonly known as the western psilochenia, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to western North America, particularly found in California and Oregon. This subspecies is adapted to rocky and open habitats, often growing in dry, sunny environments.
